Posts.Content: Hi , Don't worry about the grade 3. I had surgery 5 weeks after diagnosis and started chemo 5 weeks after that. It doesn't grow as fast as you imagine in your head. The hardest part for me now is the boredom while having treatment. I'm trying to learn to be patient and relax. Big Hugs x
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: In limbo1977 So this might be a stupid question but I will ask anyway since have my biopsy my boob has been sore and I was told to expect that I have the bruise to show for it too. It just doesn't feel right though it's sore and more sensitive than before the biopsy is that normal?  Also between now and my surgery what am I supposed to do in terms of activity do I just carry on with my normal daily tasks or do I take it easier? Ridiculous as it sounds I'm scared that if I do to much then it will make the cancer worse??  I just carried on going to work till my surgery as it took my mind off it. My boob had big purple bruise but was only sore for 3/4 days. X
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: Hi everyone.  I am about to have my third TCH but have done a lot of reading and research. There are some papers written and a lot of trials that say 4 cycles just as effective as 6 and the risk of having 6 outweigh the benefits. Any thoughts or info please xx
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Hi carolyn. Maybe your right I seem to feel more ill when steroids wearING off.  I am going to ask him about reducing dosages if he doesn't advise to stop after 4. I can honestly say this is the hardest thing I've ever done and I have had 4 natural childbirths.  My feet aren't painful but sometimes feel like there are bubbles popping on the soles when I'm sitting. My hair fell out on the first TCH but 3rd tomorrow and I have about half cm grown back already. I must have strong hair follicles.  Lol xxx
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Yes I'm 54 so no kids at home. Can rest all day if I want but it's not my nature to do nothing. Husband at work but can stay home if I have bad day. I'm a district nurse so used to being busy xc
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Hi Lyn  Mine was 25mm no nodes involved and was removed before I started chemo. That's why I'm hoping he will agree to 4. Don't hold up much hope but will see what he says. Thanks x
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Hi. The worst is day 4/5 malaise. Aching gastro disturbance  then rapid bowel emptying up to 7 x day. Feel like my intestines falling out. Start perking up day 9/10.  I have read extensive about studies that say after 4 the risks outweigh the benefits.  I am also on herc for 1 year. No node involved xc
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Thanks Ann. I am going to put it to my onc about what he thinks of me stopping at 4 and go from there. I don't want to be neutropenic and def don't want to have blood transfusion the thought makes me feel sick. My second was worse than first. It's just so hard xx
Posts.Title: 4 vs 6 TCH

Posts.Content: Lee2103 I'm due to start chemo on 24th May and would like to link in with others with breast cancer starting @ the same time.  6 cycles : 3 x Fec & 3 x Docetaxel. Grateful for any advice ? :-) Lee2103 I'm due to start chemo on 24th May and would like to link in with others with breast cancer starting @ the same time.  6 cycles : 3 x Fec & 3 x Docetaxel. Grateful for any advice ? :-)
Posts.Title: Due to start chemo 24th May

Posts.Content: Hi. Obviously empathy is. But you can't teach someone to care. You go into a nursing career as a caring person. Unfortunately too many lose that trait. What I meant was when I go back to work I will give everyone so much thought and more time when I can. Having been through this mill myself I can now better understand  xx
Posts.Title: Feelings

Posts.Content: Hi I really agree with what you said about the best nurses have been patients. I am a district nurse and when I go back to work I will never again breeze into someones house to give a filgrastim or remove a breast drain. I will totally empathise and give them more of my time xc
Posts.Title: Feelings

Posts.Content: Hi. My neighbour had builders doing his extension and every day one only saw me in my district nurse uniform. On my day off I was getting in the car to go out and he said 'you look nice today'. I was a bit surprised but I'm 54 so any compliment gratefully received  xx
Posts.Title: cheered me up ...

Posts.Content: Hi all. Just on to have a moan. On day 5 of last TCH. Got that awful slimy metallic feel in mouth. Threw up this morning so Darenth put tooth brush in or will do it again. Anyone have any ideas of what to try? Yukk x
Posts.Title: Metalic mouth

Posts.Content: Mom74 Hello, I am now 11 days post my first TAC chemotherapy. I didn't use a cold cap. So I guess I'm expecting my hair to start falling out, but it hasn't yet. My question is when it starts what is it like? Could I wake up in the morning fine, walk the dog, get to the supermarket and find I start shedding? Do I need to carry a scarf with me everywhere I go now? Any experience please? after my first chemo I got headache and prickly scalp on day 15 and the next day started shedding. It took a week to loose it all. I took advice from someone on here and paid 25 quid for revita folic stimulating shampoo. Cycle 3 tomorrow and I've got half centimetre of hair grown back. Can't believe it xx
Posts.Title: TAC and hair loss

Posts.Content: hi, I started chemo on 8/5 and had a week of theses injections from day 3, had low back pain and terrible runs. Don't know if the latter was the jab or the chemo x
Posts.Title: First chemotherapy drugs
